unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply critical thinking to issues related to people with disability and their personal goals, to action change both locally and broadly.
Draw on historical and contemporary global approaches to disability to critically examine the models that underpin Australian disability policies and practice.
Demonstrate knowledge and scholarly understanding of inclusive views of disability by applying a person-centered approach when addressing complex disability-related issues.
Critically reflect on strategies that will facilitate new professional roles in the disability sector that are autonomous, informed and unique within the diverse Australian context.

Examine and apply the principles of the World Health Organization International Classification, Functioning and Disability as a measure of health and disability to explore a person's functional needs.

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to MDisabilityStud or (EDST8301and admission to MEd)) and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Case study related to real world scenario. (2000 words)
Contribution to online discussion related to the portfolio, the case study and general online discussions
Professional portfolio based on a critical reflection model. (2000 words)

data.description: This unit will explore the theoretical underpinnings of practice in the disability sector. This unit will support students to translate from their current role to one that reflects a contemporary global disability paradigm. The unit will facilitate a holistic view of disability and encourage critical thinking that contributes to future practice within the Australian disability sector.
data.title: Perspectives in Disability
